chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deidre L Pitsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 4 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs and DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

No contact with Co-actor except by approval of Agent.
No contact with victims or Gas Station.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court addresses Atty. Lochowicz motion to withdraw as counsel. Atty. Lochowicz makes statements. Defendant does not object. State does not object. Atty. Lochowicz is released as attorney of record. records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deidre L Pitsch in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bihler makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Defendant's father makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #3.  
Imposed Sentence of:

5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 4 days )
2 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Co-actor except by approval of agent.  No contact with victims or Gas Station. 
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Seek employment;
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Cost: $278.00 bail to be applied from case # 15CF1247 
DNA surcharge: $250.00 bail to be applied from case #158CF1247
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
